body:
Pressure from others should not alter you if your beliefs correlate with what is good.

*James 4:4 - You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world means enmity against God? Therefore, anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.*
body_html:
Pressure from others should not alter you if your beliefs correlate with what is good.

James 4:4 - You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world means enmity against God? Therefore, anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
Quote something else instead (preferrably the Lord himself), James is a Jewish forgery that teaches works salvation and legalism.

Also cancel culture is just stupid, I don't think many people actually buy into it.

body:
>James is a Jewish forgery that teaches works salvation and legalism.

Lmao. What a repulsive pagan you are. James is the closest you'll get to anything resembling Hebraic thought, so of course a dedicated Greco-Roman pagan would reject it. Meanwhile there's literally no way Paul was ever a Pharisee or Pharisee or prominent student of Gamaliel. Nor did Jesus himself ever teach Pauline soteriology. But pick your path. God's day is inevitable regardless.

body: No, polytheist, Paul and Jesus didn't teach the same gospel or soteriology. And James is meant to be edifying, not a gospel account. It's also a refutation of the Pauline ideas that were clearly already circulating. Notice from Paul's own epistles how there's a dissenting fraction to Paul, and how even the communities Paul visits and writes to rejects and abandon his teachings. But not even Paul promised salvation to idolaters anyway.
body_html: No, polytheist, Paul and Jesus didn't teach the same gospel or soteriology. And James is meant to be edifying, not a gospel account. It's also a refutation of the Pauline ideas that were clearly already circulating. Notice from Paul's own epistles how there's a dissenting fraction to Paul, and how even the communities Paul visits and writes to rejects and abandon his teachings. But not even Paul promised salvation to idolaters anyway.

body: I don't know how you can say that when half the laws aren't even possible to keep not living in ancient Israel. And yes the pharisees and sadducees both strained out a gnat but swallowed a camel, and half their rules aren't even found anywhere in the bible similar to the traditions of churches today that you complain about. And yes the gentiles were never under the law to begin with, and I'm not jewish so I don't see your point.
body_html: I don't know how you can say that when half the laws aren't even possible to keep not living in ancient Israel. And yes the pharisees and sadducees both strained out a gnat but swallowed a camel, and half their rules aren't even found anywhere in the bible similar to the traditions of churches today that you complain about. And yes the gentiles were never under the law to begin with, and I'm not jewish so I don't see your point.

He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity

parent.body: No, the Torah was given to be kept, to be keepable and without expiration date. And gentiles were never under the Torah to begin with. And people specifically don't wish rules, duties and requirements.
parent.body_html: No, the Torah was given to be kept, to be keepable and without expiration date. And gentiles were never under the Torah to begin with. And people specifically don't wish rules, duties and requirements.

post.body:
Pressure from others should not alter you if your beliefs correlate with what is good.

*James 4:4 - You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world means enmity against God? Therefore, anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.*

body:
False, polytheist, the Torah itself literally says they're keepable and intended to be so. And even according to the non-Pauline, Luke 1:5-6, to be precise, the parents of John the baptist were perfectly righteous in keeping the law. And yes, polytheist, the law are keepable outside Israel too, and the fact that Israel would go without a temple and priesthood is of course prophecied too. But a false prophet like yourself would of course state otherwise. 

And the point was your Pauline soteriology and rejection of James (and Jesus for that matter). And you also don't even know what Pharisaism was and is. It has nothing to do with keeping the Torah "too well".

parent.body: I don't know how you can say that when half the laws aren't even possible to keep not living in ancient Israel. And yes the pharisees and sadducees both strained out a gnat but swallowed a camel, and half their rules aren't even found anywhere in the bible similar to the traditions of churches today that you complain about. And yes the gentiles were never under the law to begin with, and I'm not jewish so I don't see your point.

body: You're right, it has everything to do with how much you use it as a tool to judge others rather than guidelines for your own life. And yes, it was designed for ancient Israel and not all peoples of all times, you even admitted that yourself. There are two or one commandments depending on how you look at them that exist universally, and every single one of the 613 and 10 commandments was an application of that for that particular setting. And that's not just me either, unless you think that was added to all the gospels which it shows no signs of being so.

body: It's not a guideline, polytheist, it's a law. And the 613 numbers comes from Maimonides and Orthodox Judaism. And the ten commandments (pronouncements) aren't detached from the rest of Torah. And you don't even obey the single most important commandment to worship the one God alone. You don't even know what you worship or the basics of your own imposter religion.

You don't even know what you worship or the basics of your own imposter religion.
